text: Psalm 16
Confidence in Yahweh
A miktam\f + \fr Ps 16 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* of David.\f + \fr Ps 16 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Protect me, O God,
for I take refuge in you.
\add Oh my soul\add* you have said\f + \fr 16:2 \ft Reading a feminine singular verb; some Hebrew manuscripts and translations read “I said” \f* to Yahweh, “You \add are\add* my Lord.
I have no good apart from you.”
With regard to \add the\add* saints who \add are\add* in the land,
they \add are the\add* noble ones in \add whom is\add* all my desire.
Those \add who\add* hurry \add after\add*\f + \fr 16:4 \ft Or “they who acquire” \f* another \add god\add* increase their sorrows.
I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood,
nor take up their names on my lips.
Yahweh \add is\add* the portion \add which is\add* my share and my cup.
You hold my lot.
\add The\add* measuring lines have fallen for me in pleasant places.
Yes, \add my\add* inheritance is delightful for me.
I will bless Yahweh who advises me;
yes, \add at\add* night my ⸤innermost being⸥\f + \fr 16:7 \ft Literally “kidneys” \f* instructs me.
I have set Yahweh before me always.
Because \add he is\add* at my right hand I will not be shaken.
Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices.
Yes, my body will dwell in safety,
for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol;
you will not give your faithful one to see \add the\add* grave.
You will make known to me \add the\add* path of life.
In your presence \add is\add* fullness of joy.
At your right hand \add are\add* pleasures forever.
